title: Application Configuration Schema
description: This is the schema describing the structure of the app-config.yaml configuration file.

baseUrl.description: The public absolute root URL that the frontend.

title.description: The title of the app, as shown in the Backstage web interface.

host.description: The host that the frontend should be bound to. Only used for local development.

port.description: The port that the frontend should be bound to. Only used for local development.

https.description: Only used for local development. The https object is passed to webpack in order to enable using https on localhost.

certificate.description: Parent object containing certificate and the private key

key.description: Https Certificate private key. Use $file to load in a file

cert.description: Https Certificate. Use $file to load in a file

support.description: Information about support of this Backstage instance and how to contact the integrator team.

items.description: A list of categorized support item groupings.

title.description: The title of the support item grouping.

icon.description: An optional icon for the support item grouping.

links.description: A list of support links for the Backstage instance inside this grouping.

trackingId.description: Google Analytics tracking ID, e.g. UA-000000-0

scriptSrc.description:
URL to Google Analytics analytics.js script
Defaults to fetching from GA source (eg. https://www.google-analytics.com/analytics.js)

identity.description:
Controls how the identityApi is used when sending data to GA:

- `disabled`: (Default) Explicitly prevents a user's identity from
  being used when capturing events in GA.
- `optional`: Pageviews and hits are forwarded to GA as they happen
  and only include user identity metadata once known. Guarantees
  that hits are captured for all sessions, even if no sign in
  occurs, but may result in dropped hits in User ID views.
- `required`: All pageviews and hits are deferred until an identity
  is known. Guarantees that all data sent to GA correlates to a user
  identity, but prevents GA from receiving events for sessions in
  which a user does not sign in. An `identityApi` instance must be
  passed during instantiation when set to this value.

virtualSearchPageView.description:
Controls whether to send virtual pageviews on `search` events.
Can be used to enable Site Search in GA.

mode.description:
- `disabled`: (Default) no virtual pageviews are sent
- `only`: Sends virtual pageview _instead_ of the `search` event
- `both`: Sends both the `search` event _and_ the virtual pageview

mountPath.description:
Specifies on which path the main Search page is mounted.
Defaults to `/search`.

searchQuery.description:
Specifies which query param is used for the term query in the virtual pageview URL.
Defaults to `query`.

categoryQuery.description:
Specifies which query param is used for the category query in the virtual pageview URL.
Skipped by default.

debug.description:
Whether or not to log analytics debug statements to the console.
Defaults to false.

testMode.description:
Prevents events from actually being sent when set to true. Defaults
to false.

customDimensionsMetrics.description:
Configuration informing how Analytics Context and Event Attributes
metadata will be captured in Google Analytics.

type.description:
Specifies whether the corresponding metadata should be collected
as a Google Analytics custom dimension or custom metric.

index.description:
The index of the Google Analytics custom dimension or metric that
the metadata should be written to.

source.description:
Specifies whether the desired value lives as an attribute on the
Analytics Context or the Event's Attributes.

key.description:
The property of the context or attributes that should be captured.
e.g. to capture the Plugin ID associated with an event, the source
should be set to "context" and the key should be set to pluginId.

measurementId.description: Google Analytics measurement ID, e.g. G-000000-0

identity.description:
Controls how the identityApi is used when sending data to GA:

- `disabled`: (Default) Explicitly prevents a user's identity from
  being used when capturing events in GA.
- `optional`: Pageviews and hits are forwarded to GA as they happen
  and only include user identity metadata once known. Guarantees
  that hits are captured for all sessions, even if no sign in
  occurs, but may result in dropped hits in User ID views.
- `required`: All pageviews and hits are deferred until an identity
  is known. Guarantees that all data sent to GA correlates to a user
  identity, but prevents GA from receiving events for sessions in
  which a user does not sign in. An `identityApi` instance must be
  passed during instantiation when set to this value.

debug.description:
Whether to log analytics debug statements to the console.
Defaults to false.

testMode.description:
Prevents events from actually being sent when set to true. Defaults
to false.

contentGrouping.description:
Content grouping definition
Feature available in Google Analytics 4
More information https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/11523339?hl=en
Data can be grouped by pluginId, routeRef
Takes 24 hours before metrics shows up in GA dashboard
Specifies the dimension to be used for content grouping
Can be one of pluginId, extension or routeRef

allowedContexts.description:
Configuration informing how Analytics Context and Event Attributes
metadata will be captured in Google Analytics.
Contexts that will be sent as parameters in the event.
context-name will be prefixed by c_, for example, pluginId will be c_pluginId in the event.

allowedAttributes.description:
Attributes that will be sent as parameters in the event
attribute-name will be prefixed by a_, for example , testAttribute will be c_testAttribute in the event.

endpoint.description: Data ingestion endpoint to use, either bam.eu01.nr-data.net (EU) or bam.nr-data.net (US)

licenseKey.description: New Relic License Key, e.g. NRJS-12a3456bc78de9123f4

distributedTracingEnabled.description: Whether to enabled distributed tracing, defaults to false

cookiesEnabled.description: Whether to enabled tracing of cookies, defaults to false

packageName.description:
The name of the app package (in most Backstage repositories, this is the
"name" field in `packages/app/package.json`) that content should be served
from. The same app package should be added as a dependency to the backend
package in order for it to be accessible at runtime.

In a typical setup with a single app package, this will default to 'app'.

disableConfigInjection.description:
Disables the configuration injection. This can be useful if you're running in an environment
with a read-only filesystem, or for some other reason don't want configuration to be injected.

Note that this will cause the configuration used when building the app bundle to be used, unless
a separate configuration loading strategy is set up.

This also disables configuration injection though `APP_CONFIG_` environment variables.

disableStaticFallbackCache.description:
By default the app backend plugin will cache previously deployed static assets in the database.
If you disable this, it is recommended to set a `staticFallbackHandler` instead.

addr.description: The address of the Nomad API. See: https://developer.hashicorp.com/nomad/api-docs#addressing-and-ports

token.description: The token to call the Nomad API with. See: https://developer.hashicorp.com/nomad/api-docs#authentication

auth.description: Configuration that provides information on available configured authentication providers.

providers.description: The available auth-provider options and attributes

gcpIap.description: Configuration for the Google Cloud Platform Identity-Aware Proxy (IAP) auth provider.

audience.description:
The audience to use when validating incoming JWT tokens.
See https://backstage.io/docs/auth/google/gcp-iap-auth

jwtHeader.description: The name of the header to read the JWT token from, defaults to `'x-goog-iap-jwt-assertion'`.

environment.description:
The 'environment' attribute added as an optional parameter to have configurable environment value for `auth.providers`.
default value: 'development'
optional values: 'development' | 'production'

secret.description: The secret attribute of session object.

identityTokenAlgorithm.description:
JWS "alg" (Algorithm) Header Parameter value. Defaults to ES256.
Must match one of the algorithms defined for IdentityClient.
When setting a different algorithm, check if the `key` field
of the `signing_keys` table can fit the length of the generated keys.
If not, add a knex migration file in the migrations folder.
More info on supported algorithms: https://github.com/panva/jose

keyStore.description: To control how to store JWK data in auth-backend

ssl.description: Whether to use SSL when connecting.

keyFilename.description:
Local file containing the Service Account credentials.
You can omit this value to automatically read from
GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS env which is useful for local
development.

path.description: The path to use for the collection. Defaults to 'sessions'

timeout.description: Timeout used for database operations. Defaults to 10000ms

auth.description: Backend configuration for when request authentication is enabled

keys.description: Keys shared by all backends for signing and validating backend tokens.

secret.description:
Secret for generating tokens. Should be a base64 string, recommended
length is 24 bytes.

baseUrl.description: The public absolute root URL that the backend is reachable at, from the browser's perspective.

listen.description: Address that the backend should listen to.

host.description: Address of the interface that the backend should bind to.

port.description: Port that the backend should listen to.

https.description:
HTTPS configuration for the backend. If omitted the backend will serve HTTP.

Setting this to `true` will cause self-signed certificates to be generated, which
can be useful for local development or other non-production scenarios.

cert.description: PEM encoded certificate. Use $file to load in a file

key.description: PEM encoded certificate key. Use $file to load in a file.

database.description: Database connection configuration, select base database type using the `client` field

connection.description: Base database connection string, or object with individual connection properties

password.description: Password that belongs to the client User

ensureExists.description:
Whether to ensure the given database exists by creating it if it does not.
Defaults to true if unspecified.

pluginDivisionMode.description:
How plugins databases are managed/divided in the provided database instance.

`database` -> Plugins are each given their own database to manage their schemas/tables.

`schema` -> Plugins will be given their own schema (in the specified/default database)
            to manage their tables.

NOTE: Currently only supported by the `pg` client.

role.description: Configures the ownership of newly created schemas in pg databases.

knexConfig.description:
Arbitrary config object to pass to knex when initializing
(https://knexjs.org/#Installation-client). Most notable is the debug
and asyncStackTraces booleans

plugin.description: Plugin specific database configuration and client override

connection.description: Database connection string or Knex object override

ensureExists.description:
Whether to ensure the given database exists by creating it if it does not.
Defaults to base config if unspecified.

knexConfig.description:
Arbitrary config object to pass to knex when initializing
(https://knexjs.org/#Installation-client). Most notable is the
debug and asyncStackTraces booleans.

This is merged recursively into the base knexConfig

role.description: Configures the ownership of newly created schemas in pg databases.

cache.description: Cache connection configuration, select cache type using the `store` field

connection.description: A redis connection string in the form `redis://user:pass@host:port`.
A memcache connection string in the form `user:pass@host:port`.

reading.description:
Configuration related to URL reading, used for example for reading catalog info
files, scaffolder templates, and techdocs content.

allow.description:
A list of targets to allow outgoing requests to. Users will be able to make
requests on behalf of the backend to the targets that are allowed by this list.

host.description:
A host to allow outgoing requests to, being either a full host or
a subdomain wildcard pattern with a leading `*`. For example `example.com`
and `*.example.com` are valid values, `prod.*.example.com` is not.
The host may also contain a port, for example `example.com:8080`.

paths.description:
An optional list of paths. In case they are present only targets matching
any of them will are allowed. You can use trailing slashes to make sure only
subdirectories are allowed, for example `/mydir/` will allow targets with
paths like `/mydir/a` but will block paths like `/mydir2`.

csp.description:
Content Security Policy options.

The keys are the plain policy ID, e.g. "upgrade-insecure-requests". The
values are on the format that the helmet library expects them, as an
array of strings. There is also the special value false, which means to
remove the default value that Backstage puts in place for that policy.

endpoints.description:
Endpoints

A list of target baseUrls and the associated plugins.

target.description:
The target baseUrl to use for the plugin

Can be either a string or an object with internal and external keys.
Targets with `{{pluginId}}` or `{{ pluginId }} in the url will be replaced with the pluginId.

plugins.description: Array of plugins which use the target baseUrl.

organization.description: Configuration that provides information about the organization that the app is for.

name.description: The name of the organization that the app belongs to.

homepage.description: This config was used by the HomepageTimer but has been replaced  by the HeaderWorldClock in the home plugin
homepage.deprecated: in favor of the HeaderWorldClock which is found in the home plugin

enableExperimentalRedirectFlow.description: Enable redirect authentication flow type, instead of a popup for authentication.

integrations.description: Configuration for integrations towards various external repository provider systems

host.description: The hostname of the given Azure instance

credential.description:
The credential to use for requests.

If no credential is specified anonymous access is used.

credentials.description:
The credentials to use for requests. If multiple credentials are specified the first one that matches the organization is used.
If not organization matches the first credential without an organization is used.

If no credentials are specified at all, either a default credential (for Azure DevOps) or anonymous access (for Azure DevOps Server) is used.

host.description: The hostname of the given Bitbucket instance

apiBaseUrl.description: The base url for the Bitbucket API, for example https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0

username.description: The username to use for authenticated requests.

appPassword.description: Bitbucket app password used to authenticate requests.

username.description: The username to use for authenticated requests.

appPassword.description: Bitbucket Cloud app password used to authenticate requests.

host.description: The hostname of the given Bitbucket Server instance

username.description: Username used to authenticate requests with Basic Auth.

password.description: Password (or token as password) used to authenticate requests with Basic Auth.

apiBaseUrl.description: The base url for the Bitbucket Server API, for example https://<host>/rest/api/1.0

host.description: The hostname of the given Gerrit instance

baseUrl.description: The base url for the Gerrit instance.

cloneUrl.description: The base url for cloning repos.

username.description: The username to use for authenticated requests.

password.description:
Gerrit password used to authenticate requests. This can be either a password
or a generated access token.

host.description: The hostname of the given GitHub instance

apiBaseUrl.description: The base url for the GitHub API, for example https://api.github.com

rawBaseUrl.description: The base url for GitHub raw resources, for example https://raw.githubusercontent.com

appId.description: The numeric GitHub App ID, string for environment variables

privateKey.description: The private key to use for auth against the app

allowedInstallationOwners.description:
List of installation owners allowed to be used by this GitHub app. The GitHub UI does not provide a way to list the installations.
However you can list the installations with the GitHub API. You can find the list of installations here:
https://api.github.com/app/installations
The relevant documentation for this is here.
https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/apps#list-installations-for-the-authenticated-app--code-samples

host.description: The host of the target that this matches on, e.g. "gitlab.com".

apiBaseUrl.description:
The base URL of the API of this provider, e.g.
"https://gitlab.com/api/v4", with no trailing slash.

May be omitted specifically for public GitLab; then it will be deduced.

token.description:
The authorization token to use for requests to this provider.

If no token is specified, anonymous access is used.

baseUrl.description:
The baseUrl of this provider, e.g. "https://gitlab.com", which is
passed into the GitLab client.

If no baseUrl is provided, it will default to https://${host}.

googleGcs.description: Integration configuration for Google Cloud Storage

clientEmail.description: Service account email used to authenticate requests.

privateKey.description: Service account private key used to authenticate requests.

awsS3.description: Integration configuration for AWS S3 Service

endpoint.description:
AWS Endpoint.
The endpoint URI to send requests to. The default endpoint is built from the configured region.

s3ForcePathStyle.description:
Whether to use path style URLs when communicating with S3.
Defaults to false.
This allows providers like LocalStack, Minio and Wasabi (and possibly others) to be used.

accessKeyId.description: Account access key used to authenticate requests.

secretAccessKey.description: Account secret key used to authenticate requests.

roleArn.description: ARN of the role to be assumed

externalId.description: External ID to use when assuming role

host.description: The hostname of the given Gitea instance

baseUrl.description: The base url for the Gitea instance.

username.description: The username to use for authenticated requests.

password.description:
Gitea password used to authenticate requests. This can be either a password
or a generated access token.

aws.description: Configuration for access to AWS accounts

accountDefaults.description: Defaults for retrieving AWS account credentials

roleName.description: The IAM role to assume to retrieve temporary AWS credentials

partition.description: The AWS partition of the IAM role, e.g. "aws", "aws-cn"

region.description: The STS regional endpoint to use when retrieving temporary AWS credentials, e.g. "ap-northeast-1"

externalId.description: The unique identifier needed to assume the role to retrieve temporary AWS credentials

mainAccount.description: Main account to use for retrieving AWS account credentials

accessKeyId.description: The access key ID for a set of static AWS credentials

secretAccessKey.description: The secret access key for a set of static AWS credentials

profile.description:
The configuration profile from a credentials file at ~/.aws/credentials and
a configuration file at ~/.aws/config.

region.description: The STS regional endpoint to use for the main account, e.g. "ap-northeast-1"

accounts.description: Configuration for retrieving AWS accounts credentials

accountId.description: The account ID of the target account that this matches on, e.g. "123456789012"

accessKeyId.description: The access key ID for a set of static AWS credentials

secretAccessKey.description: The secret access key for a set of static AWS credentials

profile.description:
The configuration profile from a credentials file at ~/.aws/credentials and
a configuration file at ~/.aws/config.

roleName.description: The IAM role to assume to retrieve temporary AWS credentials

partition.description: The AWS partition of the IAM role, e.g. "aws", "aws-cn"

region.description: The STS regional endpoint to use when retrieving temporary AWS credentials, e.g. "ap-northeast-1"

externalId.description: The unique identifier needed to assume the role to retrieve temporary AWS credentials

airbrake.description: Configuration options for the Airbrake plugin

apiKey.description:
The API Key to authenticate requests. More details on how to get this
here: https://airbrake.io/docs/api/#authentication

apacheAirflow.description: Configurations for the Apache Airflow plugin

baseUrl.description: The base url of the Apache Airflow installation.

azureDevOps.description: Configuration options for the azure-devops-backend plugin

host.description: The hostname of the given Azure instance

organization.description: The organization of the given Azure instance

catalog.description: Configuration options for the catalog plugin.

rules.description:
Rules to apply to all catalog entities, from any location.

An undefined list of matchers means match all, an empty list of
matchers means match none.

This is commonly used to put in what amounts to an allowlist of kinds
that regular users of Backstage are permitted to register locations
for. This can be used to stop them from registering yaml files
describing for example a Group entity called "admin" that they make
themselves members of, or similar.

allow.description:
Allow entities of these particular kinds.

E.g. ["Component", "API", "Template", "Location"]

exact.description:
The exact location, e.g.
"https://github.com/org/repo/blob/master/users.yaml".

The exact location can also be used to match on locations
that contain glob characters themselves, e.g.
"https://github.com/org/*\/blob/master/*.yaml".

pattern.description:
The pattern allowed for the location, e.g.
"https://github.com/org/*\/blob/master/*.yaml".

readonly.description:
Readonly defines whether the catalog allows writes after startup.

Setting 'readonly=false' allows users to register their own components.
This is the default value.

Setting 'readonly=true' configures catalog to only allow reads. This can
be used in combination with static locations to only serve operator
provided locations. Effectively this removes the ability to register new
components to a running backstage instance.

locations.description:
A set of static locations that the catalog shall always keep itself
up-to-date with. This is commonly used for large, permanent integrations
that are defined by the Backstage operators at an organization, rather
than individual things that users register dynamically.

These have (optional) rules of their own. These override what the global
rules above specify. This way, you can prevent everybody from register
e.g. User and Group entities, except for one or a few static locations
that have those two kinds explicitly allowed.

For example:

```yaml
rules:
  - allow: [Component, API, Template, Location]
locations:
  - type: url
    target: https://github.com/org/repo/blob/master/users.yaml
    rules:
      - allow: [User, Group]
  - type: url
    target: https://github.com/org/repo/blob/master/systems.yaml
    rules:
      - allow: [System]
```

target.description:
The target URL of the location, e.g.
"https://github.com/org/repo/blob/master/users.yaml".

rules.description:
Optional extra rules that apply to this particular location.

These override the global rules above.

allow.description:
Allow entities of these particular kinds.

E.g. ["Group", "User"]

orphanStrategy.description:
The strategy to use for entities that are orphaned, i.e. no longer have
any other entities or providers referencing them. The default value is
"keep".

processingInterval.description: The interval at which the catalog should process its entities.

processors.description: List of processor-specific options and attributes

roleArn.description: The role to be assumed by this processor

orgs.description: The configuration parameters for each GitHub org to process.

name.description: The name of the GitHub org to process.

groupNamespace.description:
The namespace of the group created for this org.

Defaults to org name if omitted.

userNamespace.description:
The namespace of the users created from this org.

Defaults to empty string if omitted.

providers.description: The configuration parameters for each single LDAP provider.

target.description:
The prefix of the target that this matches on, e.g.
"ldaps://ds.example.net", with no trailing slash.

bind.description:
The settings to use for the bind command. If none are specified,
the bind command is not issued.

dn.description:
The DN of the user to auth as.

E.g. "uid=ldap-robot,ou=robots,ou=example,dc=example,dc=net"

secret.description: The secret of the user to auth as (its password).

users.description: The settings that govern the reading and interpretation of users.

dn.description:
The DN under which users are stored.

E.g. "ou=people,ou=example,dc=example,dc=net"

options.description:
The search options to use. The default is scope "one" and
attributes "*" and "+".

It is common to want to specify a filter, to narrow down the set
of matching items.

set.description:
JSON paths (on a.b.c form) and hard coded values to set on those
paths.

This can be useful for example if you want to hard code a
namespace or similar on the generated entities.

map.description: Mappings from well known entity fields, to LDAP attribute names

rdn.description:
The name of the attribute that holds the relative
distinguished name of each entry. Defaults to "uid".

name.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the metadata.name field of the entity. Defaults to "uid".

description.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the metadata.description field of the entity.

displayName.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.displayName field of the entity. Defaults to
"cn".

email.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.email field of the entity. Defaults to
"mail".

picture.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.picture field of the entity.

memberOf.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the values of
the spec.memberOf field of the entity. Defaults to "memberOf".

groups.description: The settings that govern the reading and interpretation of groups.

dn.description:
The DN under which groups are stored.

E.g. "ou=people,ou=example,dc=example,dc=net"

options.description:
The search options to use. The default is scope "one" and
attributes "*" and "+".

It is common to want to specify a filter, to narrow down the set
of matching items.

set.description:
JSON paths (on a.b.c form) and hard coded values to set on those
paths.

This can be useful for example if you want to hard code a
namespace or similar on the generated entities.

map.description: Mappings from well known entity fields, to LDAP attribute names

rdn.description:
The name of the attribute that holds the relative
distinguished name of each entry. Defaults to "cn".

name.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the metadata.name field of the entity. Defaults to "cn".

description.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the metadata.description field of the entity. Defaults to
"description".

type.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.type field of the entity. Defaults to "groupType".

displayName.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.displayName field of the entity. Defaults to
"cn".

email.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.email field of the entity.

picture.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.picture field of the entity.

memberOf.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the values of
the spec.parent field of the entity. Defaults to "memberOf".

members.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the values of
the spec.children field of the entity. Defaults to "member".

providers.description: The configuration parameters for each single Microsoft Graph provider.

target.description:
The prefix of the target that this matches on, e.g.
"https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0", with no trailing slash.

authority.description:
The auth authority used.

Default value "https://login.microsoftonline.com"

tenantId.description: The tenant whose org data we are interested in.

clientId.description: The OAuth client ID to use for authenticating requests.

clientSecret.description: The OAuth client secret to use for authenticating requests.

userFilter.description:
The filter to apply to extract users.

E.g. "accountEnabled eq true and userType eq 'member'"

groupFilter.description:
The filter to apply to extract groups.

E.g. "securityEnabled eq false and mailEnabled eq true"

userSelect.description:
The fields to be fetched on query.

E.g. ["id", "displayName", "description"]

groupSearch.description:
The search criteria to apply to extract users by groups memberships.

E.g. "\"displayName:-team\"" would only match groups which contain '-team'

groupSelect.description:
The fields to be fetched on query.

E.g. ["id", "displayName", "description"]

userGroupMemberFilter.description:
The filter to apply to extract users by groups memberships.

E.g. "displayName eq 'Backstage Users'"

userGroupMemberSearch.description:
The search criteria to apply to extract groups.

E.g. "\"displayName:-team\"" would only match groups which contain '-team'

providers.description: List of provider-specific options and attributes

awsS3.description:
AwsS3EntityProvider configuration

Uses "default" as default id for the single config variant.

prefix.description:
(Optional) AWS S3 Object key prefix
If not set, all keys will be accepted, no filtering will be applied.

region.description:
(Optional) AWS Region.
If not set, AWS_REGION environment variable or aws config file will be used.

accountId.description:
(Optional) AWS Account id.
If not set, main account is used.

prefix.description:
(Optional) AWS S3 Object key prefix
If not set, all keys will be accepted, no filtering will be applied.

region.description:
(Optional) AWS Region.
If not set, AWS_REGION environment variable or aws config file will be used.

accountId.description:
(Optional) AWS Account id.
If not set, main account is used.

host.description: (Optional) The DevOps host; leave empty for `dev.azure.com`, otherwise set to your self-hosted instance host.

repository.description:
(Optional) The repository name. Wildcards are supported as show on the examples above.
If not set, all repositories will be searched.

path.description:
(Optional) Where to find catalog-info.yaml files. Wildcards are supported.
If not set, defaults to /catalog-info.yaml.

bitbucketCloud.description:
BitbucketCloudEntityProvider configuration

Uses "default" as default id for the single config variant.

catalogPath.description: (Optional) Path to the catalog file. Default to "/catalog-info.yaml".

filters.description: (Optional) Filters applied to discovered catalog files in repositories.

repoSlug.description: (Optional) Regular expression filter for the repository slug.

projectKey.description: (Optional) Regular expression filter for the project key.

catalogPath.description: (Optional) Path to the catalog file. Default to "/catalog-info.yaml".

filters.description: (Optional) Filters applied to discovered catalog files in repositories.

repoSlug.description: (Optional) Regular expression filter for the repository slug.

projectKey.description: (Optional) Regular expression filter for the project key.

bitbucketServer.description:
BitbucketServerEntityProvider configuration

Uses "default" as default id for the single config variant.

catalogPath.description: (Optional) Path to the catalog file. Default to "/catalog-info.yaml".

filters.description: (Optional) Filters applied to discovered catalog files in repositories.

repoSlug.description: (Optional) Regular expression filter for the repository slug.

projectKey.description: (Optional) Regular expression filter for the project key.

catalogPath.description: (Optional) Path to the catalog file. Default to "/catalog-info.yaml".

filters.description: (Optional) Filters applied to discovered catalog files in repositories.

repoSlug.description: (Optional) Regular expression filter for the repository slug.

projectKey.description: (Optional) Regular expression filter for the project key.

gerrit.description:
GerritEntityProvider configuration

Maps provider id with configuration.

host.description: (Required) The host of the Gerrit integration to use.

query.description:
(Required) The query to use for the "List Projects" API call. Used to limit the
scope of the projects that the provider tries to ingest.

branch.description:
(Optional) Branch.
The branch where the provider will try to find entities. Defaults to "master".

github.description:
GithubEntityProvider configuration

Uses "default" as default id for the single config variant.

host.description:
(Optional) The hostname of your GitHub Enterprise instance.
Default: `github.com`.

catalogPath.description:
(Optional) Path where to look for `catalog-info.yaml` files.
You can use wildcards - `*` or `**` - to search the path and/or the filename
Default: `/catalog-info.yaml`.

branch.description: (Optional) String used to filter results based on the branch name.

repository.description: (Optional) Regular expression used to filter results based on the repository name.

include.description:
(Optional) An array of strings used to filter in results based on their associated GitHub topics.
If configured, only repositories with one (or more) topic(s) present in the inclusion
filter will be ingested.

If `include` and `exclude` are used, `exclude` has higher priority.

exclude.description:
(Optional) An array of strings used to filter out results based on their associated GitHub topics.
If configured, all repositories _except_ those with one (or more) topics(s) present in
the exclusion filter will be ingested.

If `include` and `exclude` are used, `exclude` has higher priority.

host.description:
(Optional) The hostname of your GitHub Enterprise instance.
Default: `github.com`.

catalogPath.description:
(Optional) Path where to look for `catalog-info.yaml` files.
You can use wildcards - `*` or `**` - to search the path and/or the filename
Default: `/catalog-info.yaml`.

branch.description: (Optional) String used to filter results based on the branch name.

repository.description: (Optional) Regular expression used to filter results based on the repository name.

include.description:
(Optional) An array of strings used to filter in results based on their associated GitHub topics.
If configured, only repositories with one (or more) topic(s) present in the inclusion
filter will be ingested.

If `include` and `exclude` are used, `exclude` has higher priority.

exclude.description:
(Optional) An array of strings used to filter out results based on their associated GitHub topics.
If configured, all repositories _except_ those with one (or more) topics(s) present in
the exclusion filter will be ingested.

If `include` and `exclude` are used, `exclude` has higher priority.

id.description:
A stable id for this provider. Entities from this provider will
be associated with this ID, so you should take care not to change
it over time since that may lead to orphaned entities and/or
conflicts.

githubUrl.description: The target that this provider should consume.

orgs.description:
The list of the GitHub orgs to consume. By default will consume all accessible
orgs on the given GitHub instance (support for GitHub App integration only).

id.description:
A stable id for this provider. Entities from this provider will
be associated with this ID, so you should take care not to change
it over time since that may lead to orphaned entities and/or
conflicts.

githubUrl.description: The target that this provider should consume.

orgs.description:
The list of the GitHub orgs to consume. By default will consume all accessible
orgs on the given GitHub instance (support for GitHub App integration only).

group.description:
(Optional) Gitlab's group[/subgroup] where the discovery is done.
If not defined the whole instance will be scanned.

branch.description:
(Optional) Default branch to read the catalog-info.yaml file.
If not set, 'master' will be used.

entityFilename.description:
(Optional) The name used for the catalog file.
If not set, 'catalog-info.yaml' will be used.

projectPattern.description: (Optional) RegExp for the Project Name Pattern

userPattern.description: (Optional) RegExp for the User Name Pattern

groupPattern.description: (Optional) RegExp for the Group Name Pattern

target.description:
The prefix of the target that this matches on, e.g.
"https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0", with no trailing slash.

authority.description:
The auth authority used.

Default value "https://login.microsoftonline.com"

tenantId.description: The tenant whose org data we are interested in.

clientId.description: The OAuth client ID to use for authenticating requests.

clientSecret.description: The OAuth client secret to use for authenticating requests.

queryMode.description:
By default, the Microsoft Graph API only provides the basic feature set
for querying. Certain features are limited to advanced query capabilities
(see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/aad-advanced-queries)
and need to be enabled.

Some features like `$expand` are not available for advanced queries, though.

expand.description:
The "expand" argument to apply to users.

E.g. "manager".

filter.description:
The filter to apply to extract users.

E.g. "accountEnabled eq true and userType eq 'member'"

expand.description:
The "expand" argument to apply to groups.

E.g. "member".

filter.description:
The filter to apply to extract groups.

E.g. "securityEnabled eq false and mailEnabled eq true"

search.description:
The search criteria to apply to extract users by groups memberships.

E.g. "\"displayName:-team\"" would only match groups which contain '-team'

select.description:
The fields to be fetched on query.

E.g. ["id", "displayName", "description"]

filter.description:
The filter to apply to extract users by groups memberships.

E.g. "displayName eq 'Backstage Users'"

search.description:
The search criteria to apply to extract groups.

E.g. "\"displayName:-team\"" would only match groups which contain '-team'

target.description:
The prefix of the target that this matches on, e.g.
"https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0", with no trailing slash.

authority.description:
The auth authority used.

Default value "https://login.microsoftonline.com"

tenantId.description: The tenant whose org data we are interested in.

clientId.description: The OAuth client ID to use for authenticating requests.

clientSecret.description: The OAuth client secret to use for authenticating requests.

queryMode.description:
By default, the Microsoft Graph API only provides the basic feature set
for querying. Certain features are limited to advanced query capabilities
(see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/aad-advanced-queries)
and need to be enabled.

Some features like `$expand` are not available for advanced queries, though.

filter.description:
The filter to apply to extract users.

E.g. "accountEnabled eq true and userType eq 'member'"

The filter to apply to extract groups.

E.g. "securityEnabled eq false and mailEnabled eq true"

search.description:
The search criteria to apply to extract users by groups memberships.

E.g. "\"displayName:-team\"" would only match groups which contain '-team'

select.description:
The fields to be fetched on query.

E.g. ["id", "displayName", "description"]

filter.description:
The filter to apply to extract users by groups memberships.

E.g. "displayName eq 'Backstage Users'"

search.description:
The search criteria to apply to extract groups.

E.g. "\"displayName:-team\"" would only match groups which contain '-team'

puppetdb.description: PuppetDB Entity Provider configuration. Uses "default" as default ID for the single config variant.

baseUrl.description: (Required) The base URL of PuppetDB API instance.

query.description: (Optional) PQL query to filter PuppetDB nodes.

schedule.description: (Optional) Task schedule definition for the refresh.

baseUrl.description: (Required) The base URL of PuppetDB API instance.

query.description: (Optional) PQL query to filter PuppetDB nodes.

schedule.description: (Optional) Task schedule definition for the refresh.

import.description: List of import flow specific options and attributes

entityFilename.description: Catalog entity descriptor filename, defaults to "catalog-info.yaml"

pullRequestBranchName.description:
A branch name used in pull request when registering existing component via UI
Valid git refname required, see: https://git-scm.com/docs/git-check-ref-format
Defaults to "backstage-integration"

providers.description: The configuration parameters for each single LDAP provider.

target.description:
The prefix of the target that this matches on, e.g.
"ldaps://ds.example.net", with no trailing slash.

bind.description:
The settings to use for the bind command. If none are specified,
the bind command is not issued.

dn.description:
The DN of the user to auth as.

E.g. "uid=ldap-robot,ou=robots,ou=example,dc=example,dc=net"

secret.description: The secret of the user to auth as (its password).

users.description: The settings that govern the reading and interpretation of users.

dn.description:
The DN under which users are stored.

E.g. "ou=people,ou=example,dc=example,dc=net"

options.description:
The search options to use. The default is scope "one" and
attributes "*" and "+".

It is common to want to specify a filter, to narrow down the set
of matching items.

set.description:
JSON paths (on a.b.c form) and hard coded values to set on those
paths.

This can be useful for example if you want to hard code a
namespace or similar on the generated entities.

map.description: Mappings from well known entity fields, to LDAP attribute names

rdn.description:
The name of the attribute that holds the relative
distinguished name of each entry. Defaults to "uid".

name.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the metadata.name field of the entity. Defaults to "uid".

description.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the metadata.description field of the entity.

displayName.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.displayName field of the entity. Defaults to
"cn".

email.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.email field of the entity. Defaults to
"mail".

picture.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.picture field of the entity.

memberOf.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the values of
the spec.memberOf field of the entity. Defaults to "memberOf".

groups.description: The settings that govern the reading and interpretation of groups.

dn.description:
The DN under which groups are stored.

E.g. "ou=people,ou=example,dc=example,dc=net"

options.description:
The search options to use. The default is scope "one" and
attributes "*" and "+".

It is common to want to specify a filter, to narrow down the set
of matching items.

set.description:
JSON paths (on a.b.c form) and hard coded values to set on those
paths.

This can be useful for example if you want to hard code a
namespace or similar on the generated entities.

map.description: Mappings from well known entity fields, to LDAP attribute names

rdn.description:
The name of the attribute that holds the relative
distinguished name of each entry. Defaults to "cn".

name.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the metadata.name field of the entity. Defaults to "cn".

description.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the metadata.description field of the entity. Defaults to
"description".

type.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.type field of the entity. Defaults to "groupType".

displayName.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.displayName field of the entity. Defaults to
"cn".

email.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.email field of the entity.

picture.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.picture field of the entity.

memberOf.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the values of
the spec.parent field of the entity. Defaults to "memberOf".

members.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the values of
the spec.children field of the entity. Defaults to "member".

codescene.description: Configuration options for the CodeScene plugin

baseUrl.description: The base url of the CodeScene installation.

endpoints.description: The list of endpoints to check.

type.description: Type of check to perform; currently fetch or ping

target.description: The target of the endpoint; currently either a URL for fetch or server name for ping.

packagePrefixes.description:
A list of package prefixes that DevTools will use for filtering all available dependencies
(default is ["@backstage"])

baseUrl.description: base url for links

topics.description:
Topics for which a route has to be registered
at which we can receive events via HTTP POST requests
(i.e. received from webhooks).

Contains a record per topic for which an AWS SQS queue
should be used as source of events.

region.description: (Required) The region of the AWS SQS queue.

url.description: (Required) The absolute URL for the AWS SQS queue to be used.

visibilityTimeout.description: (Optional) Visibility timeout for messages in flight.

waitTime.description:
(Optional) Wait time when polling for available messages.
Default: 20 seconds.

timeout.description:
(Optional) Timeout for the task execution which includes polling for messages
and publishing the events to the event broker
and the wait time after empty receives.

Must be greater than `queue.waitTime` + `waitTimeAfterEmptyReceive`.

waitTimeAfterEmptyReceive.description:
(Optional) Wait time before polling again if no message was received.
Default: 1 minute.

webhookSecret.description:
Secret token for webhook requests used to verify signatures.

See https://docs.github.com/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhooks/securing-your-webhooks
for more details.

Secret token for webhook requests used to verify tokens.

See https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/integrations/webhooks.html#validate-payloads-by-using-a-secret-token
for more details.

tools.description: Tools to be used for the explore tool provider.

externalLinkBaseUrl.description: The base url to use for external links (from Backstage to Fossa).

baseUrl.description: The base url of the GoCD installation.

Domain used by users to access iLert web UI.
Example: https://my-app.ilert.com/

proxyPath.description: Path to use for requests via the proxy, defaults to /ilert/api

baseUrl.description: Default instance baseUrl, can be specified on a named instance called "default"

username.description: Default instance username, can be specified on a named instance called "default"

apiKey.description: Default Instance apiKey, can be specified on a named instance called "default"

name.description:
Name of the instance, this will be used in an annotation on catalog entities to refer to jobs on this instance.

Use a name of "default" to specify the jenkins instance details if the annotation doesn't explicitly name an
instance.

brokers.description: List of brokers in the Kafka cluster to connect to.

ssl.description:
Optional SSL connection parameters to connect to the cluster. Passed directly to Node tls.connect.
See https://nodejs.org/dist/latest-v8.x/docs/api/tls.html#tls_tls_createsecurecontext_options

clientId.description: Client ID used to Backstage uses to identify when connecting to the Kafka cluster.

apiVersionOverrides.description:
(Optional) API Version Overrides
If set, the specified api version will be used to make requests for the corresponding object.
If running a legacy Kubernetes version, you may use this to override the default api versions
that are not supported in your cluster.

linguist.description: Configuration options for the linguist plugin

bytesThreshold.description:
Determines how many bytes of a language should be in a repo
for it to be added as an entity tag. Defaults to 0.

languageTypes.description:
The types of linguist languages that should be processed. Can be
any of "programming", "data", "markup", "prose". Defaults to ["programming"].

languageMap.description:
A custom mapping of linguist languages to how they should be rendered as entity tags.
If a language is mapped to '' it will not be included as a tag.

cacheTTL.description:
How long to cache entity languages for in memory. Used to avoid constant db hits during
processing. Defaults to 30 minutes.

baseUrl.description: The base URL for the OpenCost API

periskop.description: Configuration options for the periskop plugin

instances.description: Integration configuration for the periskop servers

name.description: The name of the given Periskop instance

url.description: The hostname of the given Periskop instance

eventsBaseUrl.description: Optional Events Base URL to override the default.

permission.description: Configuration options for Backstage permissions and authorization

enabled.description:
Whether authorization is enabled in Backstage. Defaults to false, which means authorization
requests will be automatically allowed without invoking the authorization policy.

title.description: (Optional) The title that will shown in the UI; Defaults to`Playlist` if undefined.

skipInvalidProxies.description: Rather than failing to start up, the proxy backend will instead just warn on invalid endpoints.

reviveConsumedRequestBodies.description: Revive request bodies that have already been consumed by earlier middleware.

endpoints.description:
A list of forwarding-proxies. Each key is a route to match,
below the prefix that the proxy plugin is mounted on. It must
start with a '/'.

target.description: Target of the proxy. Url string to be parsed with the url module.

headers.description: Object with extra headers to be added to target requests.

changeOrigin.description: Changes the origin of the host header to the target URL. Default: true.

pathRewrite.description:
Rewrite target's url path. Object-keys will be used as RegExp to match paths.
If pathRewrite is not specified, it is set to a single rewrite that removes the entire prefix and route.

allowedMethods.description: Limit the forwarded HTTP methods, for example allowedMethods: ['GET'] to enforce read-only access.

allowedHeaders.description:
Limit the forwarded HTTP methods. By default, only the headers that are considered safe for CORS
and headers that are set by the proxy will be forwarded.

rollbar.description: Configuration options for the rollbar plugin

organization.description: The Rollbar organization name. This can be omitted by using the `rollbar.com/project-slug` annotation.

accountToken.description: The authentication token for accessing the Rollbar API

scaffolder.description: Configuration options for the scaffolder plugin

defaultAuthor.description: The commit author info used when new components are created.

defaultCommitMessage.description: The commit message used when new components are created.

concurrentTasksLimit.description:
Sets the number of concurrent tasks that can be run at any given time on the TaskWorker.

Defaults to 10.

Set to 0 to disable task workers altogether.

confluence.description: Configuration options for the Confluence to Markdown action

baseUrl.description: The base URL for accessing the Confluence API

token.description: Token used for the basic and bearer auth methods

email.description: Email used with the token for the basic auth method

username.description: Username used with the Username/Password auth method

password.description: Password used with the Username/Password auth method

search.description: Configuration options for the search plugin

maxPageLimit.description: Sets the maximum max page limit size. Defaults to 100.

permissions.description: Options related to the search integration with the Backstage permissions system

queryLatencyBudgetMs.description:
Limits the amount of time the search backend will spend retrieving and
authorizing results from the search engine when permissions are
enabled. When the latency of the query endpoint reaches this threshold,
the results obtained up until that point will be returned, even if the
page is incomplete.

This limit is only expected to be hit for broad queries from users with
extremely restrictive visibility, or for very high page offsets.

query.description:
An object representing the default search query configuration.
By configuring and modifying the values of this object,
you can customize the default values of the search queries
and define how it behaves by default.

pageLimit.description:
A number indicating the maximum number of results to be returned
per page during pagination.

locationTemplate.description:
A templating string with placeholders, to form the final location of
the entity.

Defaults to '/catalog/:namespace/:kind/:name'

filter.description:
A filter expression passed to the catalog client, to select what
entities to collate.

Defaults to no filter, ie indexing all entities.

batchSize.description:
The number of entities to process at a time. Keep this at a
reasonable number to avoid overloading either the catalog or the
search backend.

Defaults to 500

schedule.description: The schedule for how often to run the collation job.
The schedule for how often to run the collation job.
The schedule for how often to run the collation job.

locationTemplate.description:
A templating string with placeholders, to form the final location of
the entity.

Defaults to `'/docs/:namespace/:kind/:name/:path'`.

parallelismLimit.description:
An abstract value that controls the concurrency level of the
collation process. Increasing this value will both increase the
number of entities fetched at a time from the catalog, as well as how
many things are being processed concurrently.

Defaults to `10`.

batchSize.description: Batch size for elastic search indexing tasks. Defaults to 1000.

highlightOptions.description:
Options for configuring highlight settings
See https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.17/highlighting.html

fragmentSize.description: The size of the highlighted fragment in characters. Defaults to 1000.

numFragments.description: Number of result fragments to extract. Fragments will be concatenated with `fragmentDelimiter`. Defaults to 1.

fragmentDelimiter.description: Delimiter string used to concatenate fragments. Defaults to " ... ".

index_patterns.description: Array of wildcard (*) expressions used to match the names of data streams and indices during creation.

composed_of.description:
An ordered list of component template names.
Component templates are merged in the order specified,
meaning that the last component template specified has the highest precedence.

rejectUnauthorized.description:
If true the server will reject any connection which is not
authorized with the list of supplied CAs.

If true the server will reject any connection which is not
authorized with the list of supplied CAs.

node.description:
Node configuration.
URL AWS ES endpoint to connect to.
Eg. https://my-es-cluster.eu-west-1.es.amazonaws.com

rejectUnauthorized.description:
If true the server will reject any connection which is not
authorized with the list of supplied CAs.

node.description:
Node configuration.
URL/URLS to ElasticSearch node to connect to.
Either direct URL like 'https://localhost:9200' or with credentials like 'https://username:password@localhost:9200'

auth.description:
Authentication credentials for ElasticSearch
If both ApiKey/Bearer token and username+password is provided, tokens take precedence

apiKey.description:
Base64 Encoded API key to be used to connect to the cluster.
See: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/security-api-create-api-key.html

rejectUnauthorized.description:
If true the server will reject any connection which is not
authorized with the list of supplied CAs.

node.description:
Node configuration.
URL/URLS to OpenSearch node to connect to.
Either direct URL like 'https://localhost:9200' or with credentials like 'https://username:password@localhost:9200'

auth.description:
Authentication credentials for OpenSearch
If both ApiKey/Bearer token and username+password is provided, tokens take precedence

highlightOptions.description:
Options for configuring highlight settings
See https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/textsearch-controls.html#TEXTSEARCH-HEADLINE

useHighlight.description: Used to enable to disable the highlight feature. The default value is true

maxWords.description: Used to set the longest headlines to output. The default value is 35.

minWords.description: Used to set the shortest headlines to output. The default value is 15.

shortWord.description:
Words of this length or less will be dropped at the start and end of a headline, unless they are query terms.
The default value of three (3) eliminates common English articles.

highlightAll.description: If true the whole document will be used as the headline, ignoring the preceding three parameters. The default is false.

maxFragments.description:
Maximum number of text fragments to display. The default value of zero selects a non-fragment-based headline generation method.
A value greater than zero selects fragment-based headline generation (see the linked documentation above for more details).

fragmentDelimiter.description: Delimiter string used to concatenate fragments. Defaults to " ... ".

indexerBatchSize.description: Batch size to use when indexing

sentry.description: Configuration options for the sentry plugin

sonarqube.description: Optional configurations for the SonarQube plugin

baseUrl.description: The base url of the sonarqube installation. Defaults to https://sonarcloud.io.

externalBaseUrl.description:
The external url of the sonarqube installation.
Use this if you want to use a different url for the frontend than the backend.

apiKey.description: The api key to access the sonarqube instance under baseUrl.

name.description: The name of the sonarqube instance.

baseUrl.description: The base url of the sonarqube instance.

externalBaseUrl.description:
The external url of the sonarqube instance.
Use this if you want to use a different url for the frontend than the backend.

apiKey.description: The api key to access the sonarqube instance.

splunkOnCall.description: Splunk On Call Plugin specific configs

stackoverflow.description: Configuration options for the stack overflow plugin

baseUrl.description: The base url of the Stack Overflow API used for the plugin

apiKey.description: The API key to authenticate to Stack Overflow API

teamName.description: The name of the team for a Stack Overflow for Teams account

apiAccessToken.description: The API Access Token to authenticate to Stack Overflow API

webUrl.description:
StackStorm Web UI url
Used in links to StackStorm web UI

techdocs.description: Configuration options for the techdocs plugin

builder.description: Documentation building process depends on the builder attr

legacyUseCaseSensitiveTripletPaths.description: Allows fallback to case-sensitive triplets in case of migration issues.

allowedIframeHosts.description:
Allows iframe tag only for listed hosts
Example:
 allowedIframeHosts: ["example.com"]
 this will allow all iframes with the host `example.com` in the src attribute

runIn.description: Where to run the techdocs (mkdocs) generator

dockerImage.description: Override the default techdocs docker image

legacyCopyReadmeMdToIndexMd.description:
(Optional and not recommended) Configures the techdocs generator to
attempt to ensure an index.md exists falling back to using <docs-dir>/README.md
or README.md in case a default <docs-dir>/index.md is not provided.
Note that https://www.mkdocs.org/user-guide/configuration/#edit_uri behavior
will be broken in these scenarios.

defaultPlugins.description: List of mkdocs plugins which should be added as default to all mkdocs.yml files.

publishDirectory.description: Directory to store generated static files.

awsS3.description: Required when 'type' is set to awsS3

accountId.description:
(Optional) The AWS account ID where the storage bucket is located.
Credentials for the account ID will be sourced from the 'aws' app config section.
See the
[integration-aws-node package](https://github.com/backstage/backstage/blob/master/packages/integration-aws-node/README.md)
for details on how to configure the credentials in the app config.
If account ID is not set and no credentials are set, environment variables or aws config file will be used to authenticate.

credentials.description:
(Optional) Credentials used to access a storage bucket.
This section is now deprecated. Configuring the account ID is now preferred, with credentials in the 'aws'
app config section.
If not set and no account ID is set, environment variables or aws config file will be used to authenticate.

roleArn.description: ARN of role to be assumed

region.description:
(Optional) AWS Region.
If not set, AWS_REGION environment variable or aws config file will be used.

endpoint.description:
(Optional) AWS Endpoint.
The endpoint URI to send requests to. The default endpoint is built from the configured region.

s3ForcePathStyle.description:
(Optional) Whether to use path style URLs when communicating with S3.
Defaults to false.
This allows providers like LocalStack, Minio and Wasabi (and possibly others) to be used to host tech docs.

sse.description:
(Optional) AWS Server Side Encryption
Defaults to undefined.
If not set, encrypted buckets will fail to publish.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/specifying-s3-encryption.html

openStackSwift.description: Required when 'type' is set to openStackSwift

credentials.description: (Required) Credentials used to access a storage bucket.

authUrl.description: (Required) Auth url sometimes OpenStack uses different port check your OpenStack apis.

azureBlobStorage.description: Required when 'type' is set to azureBlobStorage

connectionString.description: (Optional) Connection string of the storage container.

credentials.description: (Optional) Credentials used to access a storage container.

accountKey.description:
(Optional) Account secret primary key
If not set, environment variables will be used to authenticate.

googleGcs.description: Required when 'type' is set to googleGcs

credentials.description:
(Optional) API key used to write to a storage bucket.
If not set, environment variables will be used to authenticate.

projectId.description:
(Optional) GCP project ID that contains the bucket. Should be
set if credentials is not set, or if the service account in
the credentials belongs to a different project to the bucket.

ttl.description:
The cache time-to-live for TechDocs sites (in milliseconds). Set this
to a non-zero value to cache TechDocs sites and assets as they are
read from storage.

Note: you must also configure `backend.cache` appropriately as well,
and to pass a PluginCacheManager instance to TechDocs Backend's
createRouter method in your backend.

readTimeout.description:
The time (in milliseconds) that the TechDocs backend will wait for
a cache service to respond before continuing on as though the cached
object was not found (e.g. when the cache sercice is unavailable).

Defaults to 1000 milliseconds.

baseUrl.description: The baseUrl for your Vault instance.

publicUrl.description: The publicUrl for your Vault instance (Optional).

token.description: The token used by Backstage to access Vault.

secretEngine.description: The secret engine name where in vault. Defaults to `secrets`.

kvVersion.description: The version of the K/V API. Defaults to `2`.

scorecards.description: Extra configuration for score card plugin

jsonDataUrl.description: The public absolute root URL with json file defining the score card entries.

wikiLinkTemplate.description: The template for the link to the wiki, e.g. "https://TBD/XXX/_wiki/wikis/XXX.wiki/{id}"

travisci.description: Configuration options for the travisci plugin

baseUrl.description:
The 'baseUrl' attribute. It should point to the address of the travis portal.
If not provided, frontend plugin will use 'https://travis-ci.com/'
